text: launch phase was the most dangerous
phase of any shuttle mission because you
have four million pounds of propellant
being consumed in eight and a half
minutes to lift this quarter million
pound object into orbit and that is a
violent energy exchange a lot of things
have to work right for it to all go well
so people ask me what it's like to sit
out there and be blasted into space and
I tell them that you will fear for your
life if you don't you're incredibly
naive
when the shuttle lifts off it has three
liquid-fueled engines that reason we
start the three liquid engines six
seconds before liftoff it's because you
can shut off a liquid-fueled engine and
abort the launch where as what you like
those solid rocket boosters there's no
going back before the liftoff before the
engines start you'll see a flood of

vehicle underneath the engines many
people think that's what starts the
engines know what that is therefore it
provide an abundance of ignition sources
for any raw hydrogen that's coming out
but if you want that burn without
forming some explosive pockets somewhere
and blowing the rear end of the vehicle
on if something goes wrong with the big
white solid rocket boosters there's no
hope of recovering from that but when
you're out on the launch pad awaiting
launch there's really not a lot the crew
is doing you're strapped in it's out of
your hands there's nothing you can do
but at the same time this fear is
gripping you you're also boundlessly
joyful because for most astronauts it's
